result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

judgments.dispoDesc:
Dismissed without Prejudice
Reason:  Defendant deceased as of 03/25/16

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Deonta M. Lezine

defendant.name: Lezine, Deonta M.
defendant.address: 124 Minnesota Ave Apt 2, Stevens Point, WI 54481

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Per Court order as defendant deceased
letter from VIP Program Director, Mike Champion, recommending that the defendant successfully be discharge from VIP and charges be dismissed.

Defendant Deonta M. Lezine in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

3:39 PM Court calls case.
Court states appearances.


Matter is set for a plea/sentencing hearing today.
There is a plea agreement.

Defendant will be pleading to Count 2.
Count 1 would be dismissed and read in.

State addresses plea agreement.
Atty Drengler concurs.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.

Defendant enters a plea of: Count 2: NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney Drengler for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge.
Court finds the defendant guilty as to Count 2.  Clerk directed to WITHHOLD entry of Judgment of Conviction this date.
Count 1: Dismissed and Read In

Atty Knaapen makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Drengler makes sentencing arguments to the Court, this is  a joint recommendation.

Court addresses the parties, Court is impressed with Defendant. 

BY THE COURT:
Count 2:
VIP Program for a period of 6 Months
Conditions:
Complete 20 Hours of Community Service
Comply with recommendations made by case manager, that Defendant is obligated to perform them upon completion
Court intends to dismiss Count 2 upon successful completion of program
$500 cash bond already posted: No contact with Mark Mellum John Roycraft

2:40 p.m. Defendant Deonta M. Lezine in court. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant received a copy of the Criminal Complaint
Defendant waives reading of Criminal Complaint
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties
Court advises defendant of right to counsel and can contact Public Defender's office for representation.

Defendant would like to consult with an attorney
Defendant can contact Public Defender for Representation
Court orders defendant to see Public Defender today. 
P/NG entered.
Bond amended.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 5, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Return on warrant/Initial appearance at 09-21-2015 01:30 pm

ADDRESS INFO for Deonta M. Lezine
Current: 124 Minnesota Ave Apt 2, Stevens Point, WI 54481 United States  (Effective: 09-08-2015)
Prior: 401 Isadore Street, #336, Stevens Point, WI 54481
$500 cash alternative  - sent to JR 08-24-15 ss
2:40 p.m. Defendant Deonta M. Lezine not in court. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court finds probable cause. BTC: Warrant w/$500 cash alternative.
